blog.name: aqueenofmarble
blog.title: Do I Dare Disturb the Universe?

summary: You ever think about how Gendry was the first guy Arya trusted on her road, the first guy she told her secret to, the first guy...
body: You ever think about how Gendry was the first guy Arya trusted on her road, the first guy she told her secret to, the first guy she fell in love with and the only guy who was taken away from her. And when all hope was lost they still survived and will meet again even though they weren’t actively searching each other but it’s fate that will bring them together because they’re meant to be. They’re not just friends. Or lovers. They’re soulmates. And soulmates always find back to each other.

reblog.comment: You ever think about how Gendry was the first guy Arya trusted on her road, the first guy she told her secret to, the first guy she fell in love with and the only guy who was taken away from her. They’re not just friends. Or lovers. They’re soulmates. And soulmates always find back to each other.

summary: I had a question for you. I've always wondered what the deal was with Sansa when she told Arya that the butchers boy and Arya...
question: I had a question for you. I've always wondered what the deal was with Sansa when she told Arya that the butchers boy and Arya attacked Joffrey, when she was right there and knew Mycah did no such thing. Was she just lying to herself or what?
answer:
Self preservation. The first time she’s left alone with Joffrey, he attacks her sister with a steel sword viciously. Had Arya not dodged well, had Nymeria not bit him in the arm, who knows what could have happened? That’s when Sansa realised that her prince charming was a monster. Then she’s called to testify in front of the royal family, the people she’ll be forced to live with the rest of her life. Cersei demands Arya’s hand, Arya who was in the same social class as Sansa and yet the Queen still thought she should be dismembered for defending herself by injuring Joffrey. There are 2 options for Sansa but when you think about it, she only had one. She either chose to be neutral or she chose a side. Siding with Arya will bring Cersei and Joffrey’s rage on Sansa and siding with Joffrey will alienate Sansa from her family. So she lies and says she couldn’t remember.

Now Sansa’s coping mechanism is so rewrite her memories until they’re somewhat palatable. She’s been raised to serve her husband, to find the beauty within him so in order to do what she’s been raised to do, Sansa has to rewrite her memories and convince herself that it was Arya and Mycah’s fault especially now that her wolf has been killed by Ned. Sansa essentially feels like she has no protectors (which is why she ran to Cersei, she lost her trust in Ned) and it’s a difficult thing for a child her age to understand. So she tries to cast the Lannisters as good people and they can’t be good people without someone taking the role of the villain.

reblog.comment:

summary: I love Sansa Stark and I love Arya Stark.  Daenerys Targaryen is my favorite.  Sansa is my second favorite.  Arya Stark is my...
body:
I love Sansa Stark and I love Arya Stark. Daenerys Targaryen is my favorite. Sansa is my second favorite. Arya Stark is my third favorite. Jon Snow is my forth favorite. I’m a Jonerys shipper, yet I love them all very much.

It’s not that hard to love more than one character. Stop spreading hate when you can just spend that time adoring your favorite!

blog.name: asongofstarkandtargaryen
blog.title: Dracarys!
blog.description: Jon/Dany/Bran/Arya Stan. Salty about the got ending. Also likes: The 100,  Star Wars, Stranger Things.

summary: Honey you know D&d hate female characters and love drama
question: Honey you know D&d hate female characters and love drama
answer:
I’m not sure if I agree with the first part but I also believe that D&D love (unnecessary) drama.

That’s why they teased two years in a row “Starkbowl”, which actually never happened.  Jon and Sansa had their fair share of arguments in season 6 and so did Sansa and Arya in season 7. But at the end of the day, their put their differences behind and they were united against their common enemies.

I can see something similar happening in season 8. D&D will tease the hell out of the possibility that not everyone will imminently welcome Dany in Winterfell. Actually in the Entertainment Weekly article it was written something across the lines that Sansa won’t accept Dany at first. However, I doubt this will lead to a fight between Sansa and Dany (or Arya and Dany for the matter). Just like it happened in the previous seasons, all the heroes will unite to face the common enemy: aka the Others. And with only six episodes left, there is no time for petty fights.

Unlike what some fans believe, Sansa and Dany aren’t love rivals. And Arya isn’t a “killing machine” who will murder any girl who might get close to her brother. Those three are all young ladies, who have been through so much over the years and now they need to cooperate with the rest of humanity if they want to survive the war against the others.   And since they are all clever girls, I’d like to believe that this is exactly what they are going to do in season 8.

reblog.comment:
I’m not sure if I agree with the first part but I also believe that D&D love (unnecessary) drama.

That’s why they teased two years in a row “Starkbowl”, which actually never happened.  Jon and Sansa had their fair share of arguments in season 6 and so did Sansa and Arya in season 7. But at the end of the day, their put their differences behind and they were united against their common enemies.

I can see something similar happening in season 8. D&D will tease the hell out of the possibility that not everyone will imminently welcome Dany in Winterfell. Actually in the Entertainment Weekly article it was written something across the lines that Sansa won’t accept Dany at first. However, I doubt this will lead to a fight between Sansa and Dany (or Arya and Dany for the matter). Just like it happened in the previous seasons, all the heroes will unite to face the common enemy: aka the Others. And with only six episodes left, there is no time for petty fights.

Unlike what some fans believe, Sansa and Dany aren’t love rivals. And Arya isn’t a “killing machine” who will murder any girl who might get close to her brother. Those three are all young ladies, who have been through so much over the years and now they need to cooperate with the rest of humanity if they want to survive the war against the others.   And since they are all clever girls, I’d like to believe that this is exactly what they are going to do in season 8.

blog.description: Jon/Dany/Bran/Arya Stan. Salty about the got ending. Also likes: The 100,  Star Wars, Stranger Things.

tags: I'm tired of antis pitting these girls against each other just because it fits their shipping agenda
summary: Imagine in season 8 both Arya and Sansa actually warm up (sooner or later) to Dany and the three of them having a positive...
body:
Imagine in season 8 both Arya and Sansa actually warm up (sooner or later) to Dany and the three of them having a positive relationship.

Antis will throw a fit while I’ll be here cheering for female positive interactions.
